alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:51PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Humboldt and northwestern Elko Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 450 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 31 miles north of Midas to 13 miles southeast of Paradise Valley to 22 miles northwest of Winnemucca. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paradise Valley, Paradise Hill Summit and Chimney Dam Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
